DOC.brief_summary: The proposed study is a two-arm, randomized, single-blinded, cross-over Phase III clinical trial in which patients in 3 distinct clinical scenarios will receive the 12LEG, followed by the standard ECG, or vice-versa. Each participant will then apply the Hand ECG themselves. The 3 clinical scenarios will be: 1. patients at preoperative assessment for elective cardiac catheterization or electrophysiology procedures; 2. patients coming for outpatient cardiology appointments; 3. Inpatients admitted with a cardiac diagnosis. The electrophysiologists reviewing ECGs will be blinded to the equipment utilized to obtain the ECG.
DOC.brief_title: A Comparative Trial of Standard 12 Lead ECG to the 12 Lead ECG Glove to Assess Cardiac Electrical Function
DOC.criteria: 1. Preop assessment for elective cardiac catheterization or EP procedure. 2. Outpatient cardiology appointments. 3. Inpatients admitted with a cardiac diagnosis 1. Age less than 18. 2. Skin breakdown.
